page.title: 16LOCAL NEWS,TWYFORD.
page.content: CHERWELL VALLEY SILOS FARM HAS HAD A NEW BARN BUILT ON BANBURY LANE NEXT TO THE RAILWAY BRIDGE ON THE KINGS SUTTON SIDE.ON JUNE 13th 1985 "THE BANBURY GUARDIAN" WROTE ABOUT KINGS SUTTON'S PARISH COUNCIL MEETING WHEN THIS BARN WAS DISCUSSED.THE ENTRANCE IS CLOSE TO THE BRIDGE,WHICH IS ALSO ON A BEND.THE COUNCIL ARE WORRIED THAT BECAUSE OF THIS VEHICLES USING THE GATEWAY MAY BE A POSSIBLE DANGER TO ONCOMING TRAFFIC. A WARNING SIGN HAS NOW BEEN ERECTED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE BRIDGE. THE M40 EXTENSION WILL JUST CUT ACROSS THE SW CORNER OF THE AREA.NO ONE WE SPOKE TO IN THE AREA SEEMS TO HAVE ANY OBJECTIONS TO THIS ROUTE.CHERWELL VALLEY SILOS THINK IT SHOULD BE A HELP ALTHOUGH ACCESS WILL BE AT BANBURY NE OR BAYNARD'S GREEN.
